intro: Hartliella txitongensis, commonly known as the Transnistrian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the region of Transnistria in Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet petals. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges or rocky habitats. It is known for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species from habitat loss and environmental changes.
